description: Dmytro Natalukha, Chairman of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on Economic Development, presented a reservation model allowing businesses to reserve up to 50% of conscripted employees. The model requires no tax debts and payment of military duty, calculated as 1.5% of salary plus UAH 20,000/month. Additional requirements apply to FOP, including submission of a turnover certificate.
original:
Chairman of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on Economic Development, Dmytro Natalukha, presented the current version of the reservation model. It provides that businesses will be able to reserve up to 50% of conscripted employees.

The reservation condition is the absence of tax debts and the payment of military duty for each employee according to the formula of 1.5% of the salary plus a fixed rate of UAH 20,000/month. There will be an additional requirement for FOP - submission of a certificate of turnover in an amount not less than the value of three months of booking to confirm real activity.

description: A fire broke out in a nightclub on the ground floor of a 16-story residential building in Istanbul's Sisli district, resulting in at least 25 fatalities. The club was closed due to Ramadan, and renovations were underway when the incident occurred. Authorities have not confirmed reports of an explosion preceding the fire.
original:
⚡️At least 25 people died in a fire in a residential building in Istanbul. The fire engulfed a nightclub on the ground floor of a 16-story building in Istanbul's Sisli district, the Hürriyet newspaper reports. According to her, the club was closed on the occasion of the month of Ramadan. It is noted that before the fire there was an “explosion” near the stage.

“The cause of the fire is unknown, renovations were underway on the ground floor, all the dead were those who were repairing the nightclub,” provincial governor Davut Gul said in a press release. However, authorities have not confirmed reports of an explosion before the fire.

description: President Putin expressed dissatisfaction with Russia's current migration policy, citing cases where individuals with criminal records easily obtained labor patents and citizenship without knowing the Russian language. He emphasized the need for modern digital biometric databases to eliminate risks and relapses of illegal emigration.
original:
Forwarded from: Bad News 18+
Putin criticized the current migration policy: “When you start to understand the circumstances of a particular case, a specific crime, it turns out that the person got to Russia without any problems, went through all the formalities, issued a labor patent, often having a whole bunch of offenses behind him, and sometimes malicious. Then he applies for citizenship, without even knowing the basic Russian language. What is needed here are modern digital, electronic biometric databases. Those that are working now, they are, apparently, not enough. They do not allow us to fully eliminate risks and relapses illegal emigration. Moreover, our compatriots, whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country, sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years. I have already said that we need to deeply, radically update approaches to migration policy."The President said that “Only those who respect our traditions, language, culture and history can come to live and work in Russia. This principle should be decisive."Bad News 18+. Subscribe

event: Creation of Communication Problem Chat Bot
description: The Ministry of Digital Development of the Kherson region has developed a chat bot to gather information on voice and Internet coverage issues in the region. The bot allows users to report problems, specify their telecom operator, municipality, and locality, and provide contact information if desired.
original:
Forwarded from: Administration of Kherson region
Tell us about communication problems! The Ministry of Digital Development of the Kherson region has created a chat bot on the quality of voice and Internet coverage in the region. In the chat bot you can answer 5 short questions from the drop-down list: indicate the problem, telecom operator, municipality, locality and, if desired, leave your contact .

“Previously, we received low-quality statistics, without specifying the problem with voice communication or the Internet. description: A transport interchange construction project will begin in April in Novorossiysk's 13th microdistrict, near the Western Market and Lukoil gas station. The project aims to increase the capacity of the Anapa Highway, but will cause traffic jams during the holiday season until September.
original:
There will be traffic jams! Construction of a transport interchange in the 13th microdistrict of Novorossiysk will begin in April. Already in April, construction of a transport interchange will begin in Novorossiysk near the Western Market in the area of the Lukoil gas station. Unfortunately, the work will take place during the holiday season and will end in September. The authorities promise to minimize discomfort for motorists. But it is already obvious that traffic jams cannot be avoided. The upcoming difficulties on the roads were discussed at the deputy committee on industry, ecology, transport and communications. After the reconstruction, the capacity of the Anapa Highway will increase, officials say. Therefore, you will have to endure some congestion.

The authorities have published a project for the reconstruction of a section of the highway at the intersection of Anapa Highway and Gorky and Vidov streets. According to the document, the Anapa Highway in this area will be expanded into two lanes. Both stopping complexes near the Western Market will be moved slightly towards the center. The project also includes the construction of sidewalks and the installation of traffic lights. Regional funding in the amount of 468 million rubles was received for the implementation of the project. The work will take place in four stages.

description: The IV Student Biochemical Forum, a multidisciplinary school-conference, was held at the Faculty of Biology, Moscow State University. Russian scientists delivered lectures to students on biochemistry, biotechnology, molecular and cellular biology, and physiology and medical biochemistry. The forum aims to increase interest in biological education and prepare students for a professional career.
original: Achievements in the field of modern biochemistry were presented at the IV Student Biochemical Forum. A multidisciplinary school-conference, at which Russian scientists gave lectures to students of Russian universities in the areas of “biochemistry”, “biotechnology”, “molecular and cellular biology”, “physiology and medical biochemistry” was held on the site Faculty of Biology, Moscow State University named after M.V. Lomonosova@biomsu.💬“The forum is an important element of the new concept of biological education, it increases the interest of young people in choosing a complex but interesting specialty, prepares them for a bright professional career,” said the dean of the Faculty of Biology of Moscow State University, Academician-Secretary of the Department of Biological Sciences RAN Mikhail Kirpichnikov.🔬As part of the interactive section “Scientists Share Experience,” world-famous experts discussed current issues of bioethics and helped participants understand career tracks for young researchers.💬“Forum participants have the opportunity to listen to reports from leading scientists, developers, industry representatives, have the opportunity communicate with them and thereby see how their own scientific research is embedded in the broader context of biomedicine, understanding the molecular basis of pathology, and drug development,” emphasized Vsevolod Belousov, Corresponding Member of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Chairman of the Forum Jury.🔗More details on the RAS website.

event: Destruction of Enemy Equipment and Sabotage Group
description: A group of army aviation from the Aerospace Forces destroyed camouflaged equipment and a sabotage and reconnaissance group of the enemy in the Kupyansk direction using S-8 unguided aircraft missiles. The strike was carried out from a nose-up position, and the crews successfully returned to the departure airfield after performing an anti-missile maneuver.
original:
Meanwhile, a group of army aviation of the Aerospace Forces destroyed camouflaged equipment and a sabotage and reconnaissance group of the enemy in the Kupyansk direction.

The strike was carried out by S-8 unguided aircraft missiles, the launches of which were carried out from a nose-up position.

After which the crews performed an anti-missile maneuver using the on-board defense system and successfully returned to the departure airfield.

The strike group includes the Ka-52 Alligator reconnaissance and attack helicopter, the Mi-35M transport and combat helicopter and the Mi-8 multi-purpose helicopter.

In addition, the helicopters are accompanied by specialists from the search and rescue group and the fire support group.

During a special military operation, army aviation carries out tasks of escorting convoys, destroying armored vehicles of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, delivering troops, military cargo, and air support for units performing tasks within the framework of the special operation.

description: A demonstration of the challenges in hitting a low-maneuverable FPV target with a manually controlled FPV drone highlights the importance of specialization in anti-drone warfare. Different niches require unique antidotes and echelons of interaction to be effective.
original:
Again about anti-drone solutions.

It seems like pampering, but you can clearly see how difficult it is to hit even a low-maneuverable FPV target with a direct ram using a manually controlled FPV drone.

And at the same time, assess the probability of damage by means, such as mesh, foam, aerosols, with an expansion rate of 2-5 ms.

Although against drones that hover for reconnaissance and airdrops, the same mesh launchers can work. But the main conclusion is that in the anti-drone fight, specialization is important, each niche has its own antidote, as well as an echelon of interaction.

Until this is realized at a basic level, there will be no progress. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

event: Russia Ranks 5th in GDP at PPP
description: Russia has maintained its position as the 5th largest economy in the world and the largest in Europe, despite facing unprecedented pressure. The country's political system and economic model have proven effective, while countries that imposed sanctions on Russia are experiencing negative consequences.
original:
A new ranking of countries for 2023 has been published (in terms of GDP at PPP). Russia, despite unprecedented pressure, is today the fifth economy in the world and the largest in Europe. The political system and economic model created by our President have once again proven their effectiveness. But The states that launched an illegal sanctions war against our country continue to fully feel its negative consequences. The United States, having lost its leadership, cannot regain it. The gap with China is growing. Germany has dropped to 7th position, France to 11th, Britain to 12th, Italy to 13th, Spain to 16th, Canada to 18th. Washington’s satellites are ahead of states that have refused to impose sanctions against Russia and have made a choice in favor of mutually beneficial cooperation: Indonesia, Turkey, Mexico, Saudi Arabia, Egypt.

This trend continues for the second year in a row. Challenges have made us stronger. But much remains to be done. We need to enter the top four leading economic powers. President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin set this task for the Government until 2030. For its part, the State Duma will do everything necessary to achieve this goal."Vyacheslav Volodin"

event: Iranian Threat to Israeli Military Leadership
description: Iran may retaliate against Israel's attack on the Iranian Consulate General in Damascus by targeting the military leadership or other structures of the Jewish state. Possible responses include targeted strikes on Israeli intelligence services and military leadership, as well as mass anti-Israeli demonstrations in various countries.

Orientalist: Iran may strike at the military leadership of Israel. Israel's attack on the Iranian Consulate General in Damascus will not go unanswered, said the President of the Islamic Republic, Ebrahim Raisi.

Tehran may strike the military leadership or other structures of the Jewish state, Boris Dolgov, leading researcher at the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, told Paragraph: “Iran will respond to this blow, which is quite sensitive and painful. He has many ways and ways to respond. This [including] possible targeted strikes on the leadership of Israel’s intelligence services and the country’s military leadership. Some actions of a mass nature are also possible here, that is, anti-Israeli demonstrations in various countries, including the European Union, where the Arab-Muslim diaspora is quite large." On Monday evening, the Syrian Ministry of Defense reported an Israeli airstrike on the building of the Iranian Consulate General in the country's capital Damascus. According to a statement by Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC, the country's elite armed forces), the Israeli strike killed seven IRGC officers, including two senior generals. description: Professor Sergei Muratov, a renowned architect and academic, died after falling and hitting his head at the 'Be Healthy' clinic in Moscow. He was taken to the Botkin Hospital, where doctors fought to save his life for four days before he succumbed to his injuries.
original:
In Moscow, a professor came to the “Be Healthy” clinic, fell, hit his head and died

According to SHOT, 62-year-old Sergei Muratov came to the private clinic “Be Healthy” in Last Lane on March 26. At some point, the man stumbled, fell and hit his head hard. An ambulance was called and he was taken to the intensive care unit of the Botkin Hospital. The victim was diagnosed with a brain contusion, a fracture of the occipital bone, and an open craniocerebral injury.

Doctors fought for his life for four days, but on March 30 the man died. An inspection is underway.

Sergey Muratov is a professor at the Urban Planning Department of the Moscow Architectural Institute, a member of the Union of Moscow Architects, a member of the Creative Union of Artists of Russia, a practicing architect. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

description: Elena Blinovskaya, the 'marathon queen', is disputing a tax claim of 1.4 billion rubles, arguing that the amount should be reduced to 263.5 million. Tax officials claim she attempted to reduce her debt by spending on luxury items, including housing near Yalta and charter flights to Dubai.
original:
The tax office counted more than 6 billion rubles in revenue from Elena Blinovskaya. Today the court is considering the claim of the “marathon queen” against the Federal Tax Service, which demands that the amount of arrears, fines and penalties be reduced from 1.4 billion rubles to 263.5 million.

As a SHOT correspondent reports, tax officials insist that Blinovskaya tried to reduce the amount of debt by spending on building housing near Yalta, booking a hotel for 32 people in Bali, charter flights to Dubai and much more. However, all this was not taken into account by representatives of the Federal Tax Service, since the blogger’s defense and she herself did not provide the necessary documents. In total, the tax authorities counted Blinovskaya’s revenue at 6 billion 231 million rubles.

Lawyers for the “queen of marathons” insist that the Federal Tax Service incorrectly calculated the amount of the debt, did not take into account mitigating circumstances (for example, the fact that Blinovskaya is the mother of four children) and in general the amount of claims should be reduced. The court did not accept the defense's arguments and refused to satisfy Blinovskaya's demands. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

Philip Gazmanov refused his father's surname. Now he is Muravyov. The artist’s stepson decided to rename himself after Oleg Mikhailovich was added to the EU sanctions list in October 2022.

Philip is co-owner of Frater LLC. Muravyov has 43.1% shares. The company is engaged in cargo transportation. Revenue has already exceeded a billion rubles. A change of surname may be related specifically to business. The data in the Unified State Register of Legal Entities has already been changed.

Philip's mother married Gazmanov when the boy was five years old. As a child, he performed with the Fidgets ensemble, and when he grew up, he went into business. And now he separated completely - he took his mother’s maiden name.

Rodion is still GazmanovSubscribe to Mash

description: Ben Barry, a senior fellow at the International Institute for Strategic Studies, predicts that Russia will launch several major attacks in the spring and summer. He believes that Russia has gained momentum in its offensive due to the cessation of Western assistance and has been able to rebuild its economy, replacing lost equipment quickly.
original:
A stalemate in the Ukrainian conflict could be the best-case scenario for Kyiv, Ben Barry, a senior fellow at the International Institute for Strategic Studies, told the American television channel CNBC.

In his opinion, the worst option for the Ukrainian government is for Russian troops to break through the defenses of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in some sectors of the front. “Russia is gaining momentum in its offensive amid the cessation of Western assistance, which makes the coming months critical for the development of the conflict,” Barry emphasized. The Russian Federation will take several major attacks in the spring and summer, the expert predicts. He draws attention to the fact that Russia was able to “attract enough contract soldiers to maintain its troop structure.”

In addition, the Russian side was able to rebuild the economy and is now able to replace lost equipment in a short time, Barry believes. According to him, the Russian Federation will create a sufficient number of missiles and drones in the coming year to counter Ukraine. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Speaker Johnson faces potential removal from leadership due to his stance on Ukraine funding. Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene warned him that bringing the bill to a vote could cost him his position.
original:
Forwarded from: MediaPost
“Dysfunction” of Congress: Speaker Johnson risks losing his position because of Ukraine

Over the past year, Republicans in the House of Representatives have been unable to pass any significant legislation, and Donald Trump, an opponent of the border deal and aid to Kyiv, is to blame for this, MSNBC says.

“It just speaks to the dysfunction of the House of Representatives. Mike Johnson is clearly up to his neck in all of this,” comments TV channel political analyst Tim Miller.

Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene warned Speaker Johnson that he could be removed from leadership if he brings the Ukraine funding bill to a vote.

“People like Greene and Johnson have two different agendas. Greene told her voters that she would not support Ukraine and the like and would not support a leader who supported Ukraine.

And for Johnson, the main thing is to get something passed, to work with people in his party and with the opposite party, and this is the job of the Speaker of the House of Representatives!” says Axios senior political reporter Eugene Scott.

event: Meeting of Ministry of Internal Affairs
description: Vladimir Putin addressed the Ministry of Internal Affairs, emphasizing the need to suppress illegal migration, ensure public order, and combat extremism. He stressed the importance of objective analysis of the Crocus terrorist attack, identifying not only the perpetrators but also the beneficiaries. Putin highlighted the connection between internal and external threats, the need for increased emergency preparedness, and the importance of combating IT-based crimes.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash
"We will get to those who ordered the terrorist attack in Crocus" Vladimir Putin at the board of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The main thing:

— The priority of the Ministry of Internal Affairs is to suppress illegal migration, ensure public order and fight extremism.

— The country’s internal and external threats are often intertwined and aimed at containing Russia.

— Emergency preparedness needs to be increased. Public places in the Russian Federation must be carefully guarded.

— The analysis of the situation with the terrorist attack in Crocus must be extremely objective and professional, “we paid a very high price.”

— It is necessary to establish not only the performers, but also the chain and final beneficiaries.

— The weapon used against Russia is double-edged.

— Orders of crimes for money are not isolated. There are no reliable agents in this environment. Everything is bought and sold there, so we will reach the customers.

— Criminal syndicates operating in Russia often turn out to be cross-border, collaborating with foreign intelligence services.

— Last year the number of crimes decreased.

— More than 3.2 million residents of Donbass and Novorossiya received Russian passports.

— We need to continue working on issuing Russian passports in new regions and approach people with soul.

— When issuing passports in the Donbass, the Ministry of Internal Affairs must prevent the legalization of saboteurs and neo-Nazi collaborators.

— We need to radically update approaches to migration policy; some of our compatriots cannot obtain citizenship for years.

— Existing electronic databases are not enough to mitigate the risks of illegal migration.

— Only those who respect its traditions, language and culture should be able to come and live in Russia.

— The number of crimes using IT has increased by 30% in the Russian Federation, we need to seriously improve the mechanisms to combat them. Subscribe to Mash

description: The Cabinet of Ministers allocated 5.6 billion UAH for fortifications in various regions of Ukraine. The funds will be distributed among the Donetsk, Zaporozhye, Sumy, Nikolaev, and Kherson regions to enhance their defenses.

Ukrainian drones, operated by the Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of the Ministry of Defense, attacked targets in Tatarstan, 1,300 kilometers from Ukraine. The attack damaged an oil refinery, a special economic zone, and a dormitory, injuring 13 people. The drones targeted enterprises in Elabuga and Nizhnekamsk, including the Taneco plant, a subsidiary of Tatneft.
original:
On the morning of April 2, drones attacked targets in Tatarstan, 1,300 kilometers from Ukraine, for the first time since the beginning of the war. An oil refinery and a special economic zone where students assemble kamikaze drones came under attack✹ The press service of the special economic zone “Alabuga” was the first to report the attack, saying that the attack was on a dormitory. Soon, the head of Tatarstan, Rustam Minnikhanov, clarified that drones attacked enterprises in Elabuga and Nizhnekamsk. In Nizhnekamsk, the drone probably hit the primary oil processing unit of the Taneco plant, a subsidiary of Tatneft.

✹ The attack on enterprises in Tatarstan is an operation of the Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, RBC-Ukraine reported, citing a source in the special services.

✹ As a result of the attack, the hostel building in Alabuga was damaged. 13 people were injured. Judging by the photos and videos of the consequences of the attack, a complex of eight hostels built for students of the Alabuga Polytech College was damaged.

✹ The damaged dormitory is located 300-400 meters from the workshop for assembling Iranian kamikaze drones, which the Russian Federation is using to attack Ukraine. Polytechnic college students are involved in assembling drones.

✹ The attack on Tatarstan was the longest strike by Ukrainian drones on Russian territory since the beginning of a full-scale war.

Read more in Meduza's material.

description: The DPR has started accepting applications for enrolling children in the first grade. The process takes place in two stages, with priority given to certain categories such as children of combatants, military personnel, and volunteers. The minimum age for starting education is 6 years 6 months, and the maximum is 8 years.
original:
The DPR has begun accepting applications for the enrollment of children in the first grade. Documents can be submitted during a personal visit to the school of one of the parents or by registered mail to the address of the educational organization. Enrollment in the first grade takes place in two stages: - the first stage (accepting priority applications) - from April 1 until June 30;

- the second stage (accepting applications for everyone) - from July 6 to September 5. Preferential categories have the right to priority enrollment: a child whose brother or sister is already studying at the same school; children of combatants, military personnel, volunteers, employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the National Guard and other categories established by regional regulations. The minimum age for starting education is 6 years 6 months, and the maximum is 8 years. Subscribe | Suggest news

description: Israeli businessman Eyal Almog bought Ulvsnesøy Island in Norway, planning to transform it into a spa hotel. The island, previously a closed prison for almost 100 years, was sold to Ulvsnesøy AS in 2019 for NOK 11.8 million.
original:
Israeli businessman Eyal Almog has bought a prison island in Norway, where he plans to build a spa hotel. The Israeli wants to turn Ulvsnesøy in Hordaland into a tourist pearl.

The island was a closed prison island for almost 100 years. When it was decided to stop operating the prison in 2018, the island was purchased by private owners.

In the summer of 2019, the island was sold to Ulvsnesøy AS for NOK 11.8 million, which was NOK 3.6 million above the asking price. The island has several buildings, beaches and farms. Israeli businessman Eyal Almog from Tel Aviv owns 95% of Ulvsnesøy AS through the company Ulvsnesøy Holding.

Ulvsnesøy has a long history. In former times, there was a monastic property on the island. It was then a home for boys who were described as “liars and thieves.” The boarding school was founded in 1881 and was intended to be a “correctional and educational institution.”

The boys' boarding school was closed in 1981 and the island was used as a prison from then until 2018.

event: Ukrainian Drone Strikes on Russian Refineries
description: Ukraine has successfully conducted over a dozen drone strikes on Russian refineries since the beginning of the year, demonstrating a significant leap in range and technology. Some refineries targeted are located over 1,000 km from Ukraine's territory. The drones use AI, specifically machine vision, to achieve high accuracy and identify targets.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
CNN showed a bravura report on Ukraine's success in striking deep in Russia's rear: “It's flying straight at Russia's largest money-making company. This precise hit is one of more than a dozen Ukrainian drone strikes on Russian refineries since the beginning of the year. Two years ago, Ukraine did not have the technology for this. Some of the refineries that were hit are located more than 1,000 km from its territory. A big leap in terms of range.
According to RBC Capital Markets, about 3/4 of Russian oil refineries are within Ukraine's reach. As for their ability to avoid this fate by being shot down by Russian jamming, a source close to the Ukrainian drone program told CNN that some attacks on refineries use AI.
“They have this thing called machine vision, which, as we understand it, is a type of AI. All you have to do is take a model, put it on a chip, and over time train that model so that it can identify images, geography, and a target."
This also allows a high degree of accuracy to be achieved. Look at this kick. This is a refinery in Ryazan. The second strike is on one specific tower. “From what we see, they are striking targets that require a lot of Western technology, and it is much more difficult for Russia to acquire that technology.” Still, experts say Ukraine is showing some restraint so far. These blue dots are Russia's key oil export terminals. About 2/3 of oil and petroleum products exports pass through these ports. If one large export facility were affected, I think the impact on markets would be significant for Ukraine.” The risk here is not only our disapproval, but also Russia's revenge."

description: The blocking of Telegram is seen as an encroachment on freedom of speech, unless it's a matter of national security. While Kremlin propagandists use Telegram to promote harmful narratives, it was also a crucial platform for Ukrainian volunteers to coordinate and gather during the invasion.
original:
Due to the large amount of work, I fell out of the information field for a while. What would I like to say against the background of the latest news. About blocking Telegram:

This is nothing but an encroachment on freedom of speech, if it is not a matter of national security.

Of course, Kremlin propagandists have extremely convenient tools for promoting narratives harmful to Ukrainian society. However, we should not forget that it was Telegram that became almost the only relevant platform at the beginning of the invasion.

For example, quick and efficient communication allowed us to coordinate and gather the first volunteers into a full-fledged unit.

It was thanks to this messenger that on February 27, we quickly received relevant information about the DRG that broke through to Kharkiv, thanks to which our fighters immediately responded to such calls.
And there are many such examples.

That is, in terms of functionality and speed of information exchange, Telegram has no equal.

However, there are such destructive resources, such as the well-known anonymous telegrams of channels promoting the pro-Russian agenda. There can be no other opinion here - the Ukrainian special services must find ways to block them. If it does come to the point of blocking Telegram, so as not to lose communication, subscribe to myInstagram and Facebookinstagram.com/nemichev.kfacebook.com/nemichev.kn

We help with the transfer of important packages to the soldiers!

Body armor, unloading, mat, parcel... All this was delivered personally to the fighter of the Zaporozhye direction. The logistics of military units are not always ideally structured, especially when it comes to regions far from the Northern Military District zone. Relatives and volunteers are simply afraid to send expensive equipment and humanitarian aid “to grandfather’s village.” We deliver our humanitarian supplies to all 4 regions and can easily deliver your aid to your own fighters. Naturally, free of charge, for the sake of the common goal - Victory. The main thing for you is to send it to Crimea: SDEK, for example, transports expensive devices throughout Russia, indicating the value of the cargo.

The only thing I ask is adequacy. There is no need to send a box of canned food and socks from Siberia to Crimea and ask them to be transferred to the front line of the LPR. Situations like this, unfortunately, happen all the time. Of course, people want to please their loved ones with gifts. But not at this price. We spend our money on fuel and depreciation of transport, waste the energy and time of volunteers, and in the end we take risks. Please be respectful.

For all questions, write in private messages @valeriya_petrusevich Thank you for coordination, and often personal participation in the delivery of humanitarian goods to new territories. Thanks to Vlad for your efforts. Transport is ours, Good. And we will have the same Victory for all of you.

description: Soldiers of the 110th brigade have developed a system to suppress enemy UAVs, disrupting radio and mobile communication channels of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The system has been tested in the field, successfully jamming video communication channels of the operator and drone control.
original:
Soldiers of the 110th brigade have developed their own system for suppressing enemy UAVs - and have already conducted tests in the field. The system allows them to disrupt the operation of radio and mobile communication channels of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The range is not disclosed - it is a military secret.

Tests have shown that the system suppresses the video communication channels of the operator and drone control. The role of the mock enemy was played by the UAV operators of the training center, who changed the signal frequency in the field during the tests. “The range of the system is a military secret. We detect the drone, we understand what frequencies it uses, and we turn on one of the jamers (signal blockers - editor's note) to jam exactly the frequency that we need. This is effective, it reduces energy costs: we don’t turn on two or three frequencies, we clearly highlight the one on which it flies and jam it,” said a serviceman with the call sign “Malaya”. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: An aircraft technician at Mirny Aviation Enterprise suffered a wrist fracture after falling from a stepladder while attempting to access the cargo compartment of a Tu-154 aircraft to heat the bathrooms. The technician violated safety protocols by using an inadequate stepladder.
original:
#twenty years ago04/02/2004. To heat the bathrooms in the tail section of the Tu-154 aircraft of the Mirny Aviation Enterprise, the aircraft needed to move the sleeves of the UMP-300 engine heater through the hatch of the aircraft’s cargo compartment. To get into the cargo compartment, the aircraft technician, in violation of technology and labor safety instructions, used a stepladder that was not intended for this purpose (the stepladder was not high enough to enter the cargo compartment).
    In the process of moving from the stepladder, the aircraft technician knelt with one foot in the hatch opening and pushed off the stepladder with the other leg to get into the cargo compartment. At the same time, the stepladder moved, and the aircraft technician, having lost his support, fell onto the concrete surface of the parking lot, resulting in a fracture of the wrist joint of his left hand.

event: Research Expedition on R/V Professor Vodyanitsky
description: Scientists from four Sevastopol institutions, including FRC InBYUM RAS, MHI, IPTS, and SevSU, conducted a 26-day research expedition on the R/V Professor Vodyanitsky in Crimean waters. The expedition involved over 100 stations, with five scientific teams collecting data on radionuclides, heavy metals, and planktonic organisms.
original: This year's first expedition of the R/V "Professor Vodyanitsky" has ended. The Crimean waters were explored for 26 days on board the research vessel "Professor Vodyanitsky" by scientists from four scientific institutions of Sevastopol - FRC InBYUM RAS@ibss_ras, MHI, IPTS and SevSU.🛳During 130 On the 1st voyage, more than a hundred stations were completed, at which five scientific teams of marine hydrobiologists of the FRC InBYUM successfully completed all tasks. Thus, a team from the Department of Radiation Chemical Biology received new data on the distribution of radionuclides 90Sr, 137Cs, 210Po, 239+240Pu, as well as heavy metals, organochlorine compounds and mercury in water. Ichthyoplankton and phytoplankton teams collected a large number of samples, the analysis of which will allow, in particular, to study the distribution, population dynamics and migratory properties of planktonic toxic diatoms of the genus Pseudo-nitzschia.💬“The main composition of the expedition included a large number young specialists and graduate students, for some of them this was their first experience of participating in sea expeditions,” said the head of the expedition, Art. n. With. bioluminescence laboratory of the Federal Research Center InBYUMAlexander Melnik.🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

event: Meeting between Nicola, Ursula and Blinken
description: A trilateral meeting between Nicola, Ursula, and Blinken is scheduled to take place in Brussels on April 5. This meeting has drawn attention from experts due to its unique format. The Armenian authorities are aware that such contacts pose a threat to Iran, which has consistently opposed third-party military presence in the region.
original: Meeting between Nicola, Ursula and Blinken in Brussels. In whose garden will the stones fly? VIEW FROM TEHRANIranian analyst Kayhan Barzegar: Close contacts between the Armenian authorities and Western leaders and Yerevan’s pro-Western decisions have long worried Iran, and official Tehran regularly speaks about this. The upcoming trilateral meeting on April 5 is, of course, also no exception and has attracted a lot of attention from experts due to the specific format of the meeting. The RA authorities are well aware that such contacts pose a threat to Iran. In a broader context, Iran has consistently stated that it does not want a third party military presence in the region. If necessary, Iran will express its opinion. And Armenia will not find it enough. The “closeness” of Armenia and the West has brought some coldness and lack of mutual understanding into relations between Yerevan and Tehran, since Iran and Armenia have completely different views on Western policy in the South Caucasus and Western policy in general... The West needs Armenia situationally. It is difficult to say where political commitments and existing problems will lead the parties...@Caucasian_bureau

event: Vladimir Putin's Speech at Ministry of Internal Affairs
description: Vladimir Putin addressed the board of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, emphasizing the need to identify all parties involved in the terrorist attack at Crocus, including perpetrators, links, and beneficiaries. He highlighted the importance of combating extremism, suppressing illegal migration, and fighting organized crime.
original:
Vladimir Putin spoke at the board of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. Main:

“It is necessary to identify not only the perpetrators, but also all the links in the chain and the final beneficiaries of the terrorist attack at Crocus.” We will definitely get to them.

“This weapon [terrorist attacks] that is used against Russia is a double-edged weapon.

— The priority of the Ministry of Internal Affairs is ensuring public order, combating extremism, suppressing illegal migration, the work of local services and the fight against organized crime.

— Criminal syndicates operating in Russia often turn out to be cross-border, collaborating with foreign intelligence services.

“We must approach those who apply for a Russian passport and other frequently lost documents carefully, with utmost care and with sincerity.

— In a very difficult situation, more than 3.2 million residents of the DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions received Russian passports.

— Illegal migration is a breeding ground for extremism and criminality. At the same time, it is unacceptable to use recent tragic events to provoke national hatred.

— Thanks to everyone who goes on combat missions. Divisions of the Ministry of Internal Affairs have been formed in all new subjects of the federation.

event: Construction of Golden Sands of Russia Embankment
description: Under the project 'Golden Sands of Russia', a 24 km long embankment, the longest in Russia, will be built in the resort town of Yevpatoria, Crimea. The pedestrian-friendly embankment will feature paths for electric scooters, bicycles, and electric cars, connecting to Simferopolskaya Street and other embankments.
original:
Forwarded from: What, again?
🏖In Crimea, under the project “Golden Sands of Russia”, the longest embankment in Russia, more than 20 km long, will be built. It is planned to open in the area of the resort town of Yevpatoria in the western part of the peninsula. “As part of the largest investment project “Golden Sands of Russia”, we will create a unique resort that will have no analogues in the south of Russia. It is planned to make a single embankment of about 24 km. It will become the longest in Russia," the Monolit company, which acted as a key investor and developer of the project, told TASS. The embankment of the Golden Sands of Russia complex will be connected to Simferopolskaya Street , embankments named after Tereshkova and them. Frunze, and then from the Azure Embankment along the coast of Yevpatoria Bay. The embankment will be mainly pedestrian, but it will also have a path for traveling on electric scooters and bicycles, as well as a path for electric cars.

The project “Golden Sands of Russia” is promised to be implemented by 2030.@cho_opyat

event: Terrorist Attack at Crocus City Hall
description: A terrorist attack at the Crocus concert venue in Moscow resulted in nearly 140 deaths and an equal number of injuries. While Western media blamed ISIS, terrorism experts suggest the organization was created by the US as a tool against the Taliban. The head of the FSB, Alexander Bortnikov, stated that preliminary data indicates the involvement of the USA, Great Britain, and Ukraine, with the culprits heading towards Ukraine.
original:
Who is behind the Crocus City Hall terrorists? In the West, the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall was blamed on ISIS*. The author of the article for Steigan tried to figure out who is really behind this tragedy. Back in 1999, Washington used jihadists in the war in Kosovo, and today Kyiv has established cooperation with them, the journalist recalled.

As a result of the terrorist attack at the Crocus concert venue in Moscow, almost 140 people were killed and about the same number were injured. Who was behind this terrorist attack? In Western capitals and the mainstream media, they were quick to blame the offshoot of ISIS * “Vilayat Khorasan” (a branch of ISIS banned in Russia). However, terrorism experts note that the organization was created by the United States in Afghanistan as a tool against the Taliban*. So who was really behind the terrorist attack? At this stage, we do not have all the information and therefore are still waiting for final conclusions. But let us note Gilbert Doctorow's comment with reference to the recent statement by the head of the FSB, Alexander Bortnikov.

“At a press conference in Moscow, Bortnikov said: the USA, Great Britain and Ukraine are behind the terrorist act committed by Islamic extremists.”
Bortnikov said that preliminary data indicates that the four culprits were heading by car towards Ukraine, where they were waiting on the other side of the border.
He calmly explained that the involvement of foreign powers was being investigated and that he would not make emotional statements, but would wait until the facts were collected and documented before presenting them to the public."@node_of_time_RUS

description: Pro-Russian channels broadcast a propaganda video aimed at undermining trust in Ukrainian authorities. The video, featuring Russian actors Maxim Gromov and Oleksandr Panov, contrasts the luxurious life of one character with the front-line struggles of another, inciting discontent among Ukrainians.
original:
​​📺Pro-Russian channels broadcast a propaganda video about mobilization in Ukraine, designed to undermine the trust of Ukrainians in the authorities.

Russian professional actors — 26-year-old Maxim Gromov from Tyumen and 31-year-old Oleksandr Panov from Yaroslavl — starred in it, "Agency" learned.

The video in Ukrainian, the leitmotif of which is the phrase "His son is the elite, and you are the meat", began to be distributed on April 1 by pro-Russian Telegram channels.

The video is based on the juxtaposition of two fictional young people. The video shows that the first character seems to be living a luxurious life, while the other is on the front lines.

The clip ends with the phrase: "You know whose sons are not affected by the mobilization" and is obviously aimed at inciting discontent among Ukrainian citizens.

"Agency" adds that the "main idea" of the video can be fully applied to the Russian elite, where the children of high-ranking officials and businessmen avoided mobilization🔻subscribe

description: Kyrgyzstan's President Sadyr Japarov signed a decree creating a register of foreign agents, requiring listed organizations to mark publications with a special label and submit reports to the state. Japarov assured that there will be no persecution, promising equal terms for all.
original:
Kyrgyzstan has its own list of foreign agents. Those on the list will be required to mark publications with a special label and submit reports to the state. The decree on the creation of the register was signed by the President of the Republic, Sadyr Japarov. According to him, the law was adopted so that “everyone works on equal terms, and it will benefit Kyrgyzstan. Japarov also promised not to pursue organizations declared foreign agents. “You have been working with foreign donors for 30 years, and no one has persecuted you for taking any amounts. Shall we start doing this now? As head of state, I guarantee that there will be no persecution. We are not a nuclear country. We are not going to fly into space yet. Our state has no secrets that need to be hidden from you and your donors,” Japarov said on Facebook*.

Local Kloop writes that once the law is passed, organizations identified as foreign agents will be required to provide additional reports and may be subject to unscheduled inspections. They will also be required to mark their materials with a foreign agency label.

*belongs to Meta, recognized as extremist

description: A list of Arab countries with the cheapest gasoline prices, including Kuwait, Algeria, Syria, and Saudi Arabia, where governments use oil revenues to subsidize fuel costs, making it affordable for local populations.
original:
⛽️List of countries with the cheapest gasoline

Gasoline prices can vary depending on various factors: oil refining and transportation, economic conditions, and so on. These conditions may affect the final cost of gasoline. Like, for example, in Syria.💬We have made a selection of Arab countries with the cheapest gasoline.✔️Kuwait has 7% of the world's oil reserves. Most oil is produced on land. As of 2023, the cost of gasoline in Kuwait was only $0.27 per liter.✔️Algeria has significant oil reserves, and the Algerian government has managed to keep the cost low for its citizens. At the end of March 2024, the cost of gasoline was $0.34.✔️In Syria, it is possible to purchase 75 liters of subsidized gasoline per month at a price of $0.21 per liter, which is approximately equal to 15 rubles. However, if you need to purchase gasoline in excess of this limit, the price per liter increases significantly and reaches about 58 rubles. At the end of March, the cost of Syrian gasoline per liter was $0.968. ✔The price of gasoline in Saudi Arabia is $0.62 per liter. Gasoline in Saudi Arabia accounts for 90% of the country's export revenue. The cost of fuel is regulated by the state itself. Due to the deteriorating economic state of the budget, the government decided to increase gasoline prices. Thus, in 2024, the cost of grade 95 fuel increased from 16 to 24%. The removal of subsidies for diesel, gasoline, electricity and gas was caused by a fall in oil prices.

In these countries, governments often use oil revenues to subsidize the cost of fuel, making it affordable for local populations to maintain a high standard of living and maintain economic stability despite external economic challenges.

In Russia, despite its vast oil reserves, gasoline prices may be higher than expected due to various internal factors, including taxes and the structure of the oil industry. The current price is $0.60 per liter.

It was on this day two years ago that the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine officially announced the complete liberation of the region from Russian occupiers. Together with the de-occupation of the Sumy and Chernigov regions, success in the battle for Kyiv and northern Ukraine became a decisive turning point in the beginning of a full-scale Russian invasion.

The fighting in the region lasted 39 days. 15 communities of Buchansky, Vyshgorod and Brovary districts found themselves under occupation.

In two years after the deoccupation of the north of Ukraine, law enforcement officers discovered 1,590 bodies of the dead in the territory of the Kyiv region alone.

1202 - civilians,
208 - military personnel and police,
180 - unidentified persons.

description: Russian forces have taken control of Avdeevka, a key location. The 'Ghouls' are flying and even destroying Abrams tanks.
original:
Forwarded from: Andrey Medvedev
The year since our brother Maxim Fomin found the life of the future century, for which every Orthodox Christian prays.

Brother Maxim, I’m sure you see everything. Avdeevka is ours. "Ghouls" fly and even burn Abrams. What we didn't have time to do, we'll finish.
Everything will be as we like.

Pray for the warrior Maxim, and for all the Russian soldiers who laid down their lives for the Fatherland and were martyred in captivity.
It's not all in vain. We will overcome everything, we will overcome everything.

“Be of good cheer, do not become discouraged. Dejection is the most terrible sin.

We will definitely win. The enemy will be defeated, victory will be ours.

All the best to everyone."

description: The State Duma is discussing the possibility of Russia abandoning the UN Convention on the International Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) in the Arctic, opting for the sectoral principle of determining boundaries in the Arctic Ocean. This move would allow Russia to assert its special role in the region, taking advantage of its pronounced advantages in the area.
original:
Forwarded from: Captain Arctic
Will they reach UNCLOS? A “mini-sensation” is speeding up: the State Duma is considering the issue of abandoning the UN Convention on the International Law of the Sea (UNCLOS/ILC) in the Arctic and returning to the sectoral principle of determining boundaries in the Arctic Ocean.

There's nothing particularly new here.

Back in 2019, we wrote that our leadership had this option - ending UNCLOS in the Arctic - on the table, as they say. It was discussed in the corridors of power both in 2020 and later. Now, observing what was happening, supporters of this position decided that at the moment the advantages of withdrawing from the convention began to outweigh the disadvantages. However, “this is not certain.” The final decision has not yet been made - but the chances of it are growing.

In this regard, we repeat our position.

It’s great when there are generally recognized international norms that guide states in their relations with each other, before which everyone is equal, etc. But at present, the United States and others like it shamelessly claim to have a global and monopolistic determination of who can “fight with their neighbors” (tm) and who cannot, what is moral and what is not, what corresponds to the “rules”, and what is wrong, who can trade with whom and in what currency, who is right and who is wrong, etc. Accordingly, we do not need such a world based on such rules.

At the same time, the Arctic is perhaps the only territory and the only area of competition with the West (and East) where Russia has pronounced advantages. And at a time when the rules are crumbling, when international law turns into a game in the hands of Washington, when the right of the strong comes to the fore - in such times, Russia can and should assert for itself, by this very right, its special role in the Arctic.

What, Western “friends and partners”? Did you want “might is right”? Fine! To paraphrase your famous poem, we can say: We will give our answer to any of your questions:
We have an icebreaker, but you don’t.#NSR#strategyIzvestiaRussia is studying the issue of withdrawing from the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea in the Arctic.In order to protect its national interests, Russia may reconsider its participation in the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea in the Arctic, Izvestia said ...

description: China is working on a new type of weapon, a hypersonic missile capable of overcoming long distances and evading interception. The concept's success depends on the missile's ability to find its target while in a plasma cocoon. Russia already has a similar platform, the Zircon hypersonic missile, which could potentially be adapted to intercept AWACS aircraft.
original:
An interesting topic recently appeared on tg channels. China has essentially set its sights on creating a new type of weapons. Before this, a similar task fell on manned fighters, which had to go to the launch line, and from there, if they managed to survive, shoot down such a big target as an AWACS aircraft. The Chinese propose to solve this issue due to the enormous speed at which it is extremely difficult to shoot down a missile, and thereby quite reliably overcome such a distance.

The real question is how he will find the target of his radar while in a plasma cocoon... a very important question on which whether this concept has a chance largely depends.

The most interesting thing is that we essentially already have our own version of such a platform, the Zircon hypersonic missile. Perhaps it makes sense to turn the Zircon into an AWACS interceptor in the theater of operations.

This will be a very strong move, in general. True, the question of the operation of the guidance system remains open. But at least we have somehow resolved the issue of targeting ships and ground targets, so there may well be a chance of success. If it works out, then Zircon in a potential naval battle with the AUG will be able to change the entire battle tactics. A large number of universal missiles can destroy the enemy’s “eyes” and subsequently disable him.

But this is all hypothetical for now, because no one has canceled the plasma cocoon around him. And it essentially creates invulnerability for hypersonic missiles, since their interception forces the enemy to receive exactly the same cocoon.

But there is no point in discussing further, all the details there are too secret, you can accidentally guess, and whoever gives the correct answer is...😁Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

description: Russian goalie Ivan Fedotov made his NHL debut for Philadelphia, replacing the starting goalie in the second period. He saved 19 of 21 shots but couldn't prevent the team's 3:4 overtime loss to the Islanders. Notably, Fedotov was confused about the goal change before overtime due to differing rules between the KHL and NHL.
original:
Russian goalie Ivan Fedotov made his NHL debut for Philadelphia and did not save his club from defeat in the match with the Islanders. The 27-year-old goalkeeper came on as a substitute in the second period and stopped 19 of 21 shots, but Philadelphia lost in overtime with a score of 3:4.

Before the start of overtime, Fedotov mixed up the goals due to different interpretations of the rules in the KHL and NHL. In the Russian league, teams do not change goals before overtime, while in the NHL this happens.

“Today at 05:45 in the morning, the Alabuga hostel was attacked by two drones. Indeed, they are attacking shopping centers in Moscow, they are attacking residential areas in Belgorod, they are attacking hostels in Alabuga. It is against such people that we are carrying out a special military operation,” said Timur Shagivaleev, Director General of the Alabuga SEZ.

UPD: Three of the six victims were hospitalized. All are in a state of mild to moderate severity.

event: Ruslan Bortnik's Statement on Ukraine's War Goals
description: Political scientist Ruslan Bortnik stated that Ukraine's strategic goals in the confrontation with Russia are unattainable. He believes that setting unrealistic goals, such as capturing Moscow or Crimea, is no longer credible. Instead, the government is seeking to establish achievable goals to maintain societal support and provide hope for the future.
original: ❗️The war goals declared by Ukraine are unattainable for us - Bortnik. Most strategic goals in the confrontation with Russia are unattainable for Ukraine and its Western partners. Political scientist Ruslan Bortnik said this on air on the PolitBuro Internet channel, a PolitNavigator correspondent reports.🔴According to the expert, this is happening because no one believes the words about the capture of Moscow or even Crimea anymore.🗣“This is an attempt to set a goal for the future . In this war, it is very difficult to establish a target that would be trusted by its society and Western partners. To say that we will win the war and tomorrow we will take Moscow - not even tomorrow, in 20 years we will take Moscow - you can do this, but no one believes it anymore. That is why to say that we can simply be on the defensive all the time in a situation with UFABs and everything else - no one believes in this either,” the expert said.🗣 “That is why, in this dynamic, our government is constantly looking for points of information support so that further goal to society, to explain what we are for, for what specific goal - not the virtual liberation of the entire country, but for what specific goal we are fighting and dying today... This is a technology for managing society, an attempt to give hope in the future, an attempt to set goals in conditions when the majority strategic goals are simply unattainable for both us and our Western partners,” said Bortnik. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301723VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 13 s from 2 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: The Ukraine-Russia conflict has reached a bloody stalemate, with neither side willing to accept each other's minimum demands. Russia demands new leadership in Ukraine, while Ukraine demands reparations. Both sides refuse to give up territory, making a negotiated settlement unlikely without dramatic changes on the battlefield or in leadership.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Obstacles to diplomacy in Ukraine”: Foreign Affairs concluded that there can be no peace talks now, but at the same time calls Russia’s demands “too extreme”, and Kiev’s demand for reparations is normal.

“After more than two years of fighting, Russia's invasion of Ukraine has reached a bloody stalemate. Typically, such situations are described as “stalemate, causing mutual harm,” and often this forces the parties to negotiate, they begin to consider previously unacceptable concessions.✔️But this military conflict has not reached the stage where its termination through negotiations is even possible in principle. To make peace, both sides must be willing to accept each other's minimum demands. But neither Russia nor Ukraine can do this.✔️Kiev, for example, does not recognize Russia’s demand for new leadership. Moscow does not accept Ukraine's demand for reparations. Both sides will not give up territory.✔️No amount of creative diplomacy can change these facts. For both countries, continued fighting is preferable to a settlement. And unless there are dramatic changes in the battlefield or in the leadership of one of the states, it is extremely unlikely that both sides will reconsider their demands in the long term.✔️For there to be any chance of a negotiated settlement, the Russians would have to admit that their demands are too extreme. But the Kremlin is not interested in peace. All his statements about readiness for negotiations are kabuki theater designed to present Moscow in a favorable light in order to undermine international support for Ukraine. Neither state seems ready to change course. So the most likely outcome is continuation of hostilities.✔️Now the Russians have the initiative on the battlefield. Aid to Ukraine, by contrast, has stalled in Congress and Western unity is shaky. Putin is right about one thing: Ukraine’s sovereignty exists as long as it can be protected from Moscow’s grasp.”

event: Charity Event in Support of Donbass
description: A charity event was held in London to support the residents of Donbass. Despite initial difficulties, the event was successful, with a large turnout and funds collected for humanitarian aid.
original:
"A charity event was held in London in support of the residents of Donbass."
9 years ago today in my hometown of London I held a charity event in support of Donbass. Even then it was not easy - most establishments refused me, but how
Show more
They say it’s difficult, but it’s possible! Let's break through!!
It’s true that there was one provocateur, but overall there were so many people there, our people, that a big line formed on the street! Soon I returned to Donbass and donated all the funds collected to humanitarian aid. And by the way, I remember that Givi was very interested in this event and asked me about it.
After 9 years, the status of Great Britain and Donbass has not changed. Great Britain is not at war with Donbass. The status of Great Britain and Russia has not changed - Great Britain is not at war with Russia. However, I can't even get into my hometown due to sanctions imposed on me by the British government for telling the truth about Donbass. And just imagine what would happen if someone tried to hold such an event now, in support of Donbass.....
Here are 9 years of “democratic progress in good old Albion”...

description: A 12-year-old schoolgirl was killed and two others were seriously injured in a shooting at a Finnish school. The 12-year-old suspect, who fled the scene, was later detained by security forces on the other side of a local river in Helsinki. The incident is being investigated as murder and attempted murder, but no criminal case will be initiated due to the suspect's age.
original: ⚡️A 12-year-old schoolgirl died in a shooting at a Finnish school, two of her peers remain in hospital with serious injuries. Police reported that the 12-year-old suspect fled after the shooting and was detained on the other side of a local river in the northern region of Helsinki. The firearms that the child had with him were taken away by security forces. The shooting incident is being investigated as murder and attempted murder. However, no criminal case is initiated because the suspect is a minor. Finnish President Alexander Stubb said he was shocked by the events in Vantaa. There were no Russian citizens among the victims, the Russian Embassy in Finland reported.@radiomirby

description: Turkey ranked third globally in TV series script exports, with a 184% increase in global demand from 2020 to 2023. The main importing countries were Spain, Saudi Arabia, and Egypt. The Istanbul Chamber of Commerce and Industry estimated revenue from TV series exports at $600 million in 2022, with predictions of reaching $1 billion in the future.
original:
📺Turkey ranked third in the world in the number of exported scripts for TV series.

According to Parrot Analytics, from 2020 to 2023, global demand for Turkish dramas increased by 184%, overtaking Korean dramas, which accounted for 73%.

Some of the main importing countries of Turkish scripts for TV series were Spain, Saudi Arabia and Egypt.

According to the Turkish online publication Politikyol, the Istanbul Chamber of Commerce and Industry estimated revenue from the export of television series at $600 million in 2022, with some analysts predicting that this figure will rise to a billion in the future.

🤬The son of Yanukovych's security chief tortured people in the Zaporizhzhia region

The 28-year-old criminal oversaw the filtration camp in Kamiansko-Dniprovka. On his orders, people were beaten and strangled, and he simulated the execution of detainees

According to preliminary estimates, up to a hundred people were held in the filtration camp. "He organized all the torture," said a 51-year-old resident of Zaporozhye, who was lucky enough to get out of the filtration camp. "On his orders, I was beaten and strangled. He simulated my execution and told me that two divisions of Chechens would come and rape me...". description: Today marks the anniversary of Vladlen Tatarsky's death, a renowned military correspondent, writer, and officer from Makeyevka. He was a priority target for the enemy due to his active stance. Tatarsky embodied a new standard of journalism, fighting, filming, and engaging in volunteer activities. His legacy continues to inspire as a national hero.
original:
Forwarded from: Lomovka
Today is the anniversary of the death of Vladlen Tatarsky (military correspondent Maxim Fomin). Vladlen was a simple guy from Makeyevka. Over time, he became a famous militiaman, writer and military officer, whom perhaps everyone knows. For his active position, the enemy made Tatarsky one of his priority targets.

In fact, it was he who embodied by his example a new standard of journalism. Vladlen fought, filmed, and was actively involved in volunteer activities. His “main military show of the country, evening Vladlen,” was watched and loved by the country.

Maxim Fomin remained a national hero even after his death. There will be a Novorossiya, there will be! - the journalist liked to say.

Fortunately, he waited until new regions joined Russia. And our victory will also definitely be, at least for the sake of all the guys and girls who defend the honor and freedom of our country at their posts.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Three carriages of a freight train derailed on the Zhaima-Mana section in the Krasnoyarsk Territory. The incident may have been caused by the train's automatic brakes being activated, leading to a collision with a passenger train traveling in the opposite direction. Fortunately, there were no casualties.
original:
Three carriages of a freight train derailed in the Krasnoyarsk Territory. The incident occurred on the Zhaima-Mana section, the press service of the Krasnoyarsk Railway reports.

The Eastern Interregional Investigation Department of Transport of the Investigative Committee notes that the derailment of the cars could have happened due to the train’s automatic brakes being activated. “The next passenger train in the opposite direction, traveling from Krasnoyarsk to Abakan, did not have time to stop and collided with the overturned car,” the department added. event: Restoration of Justice for Ukraine Conference
description: President Zelenskiy emphasized the importance of justice in achieving reliable peace and security. He stressed that justice can ensure accountability for aggressors and provide a sense of predictability in global relations. The conference in The Hague aims to coordinate international efforts for justice and investigate Russian war crimes.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
It is justice that is the line from which the movement towards a reliable peace can begin. Weapons provide physical protection, but it is justice that restores the sense of security to life that was protected by the power of arms. And a sense of predictability of all global relations. Every potential aggressor should know what awaits him if he destroys the peace. It is justice that can ensure this.

We must do everything possible for the sake of the power of justice, so that justice gives real power to our common security - security from Russian aggression and terror. And let everyone who destroys the peace be truly afraid of ending up on the dock in The Hague.

He said this during the "Restoration of Justice for Ukraine" conference. It is taking place today in The Hague and unites states and organizations working to achieve justice for Ukraine. The conference is designed to take stock of progress in the investigation of Russian war crimes and the coordination of international efforts for justice.

description: Thomas Bach, the head of the International Olympic Committee, revealed the organization's anti-Russian policy in a conversation with Russian pranksters. He intends to dissuade Africa from participating in the World Friendship Games in Russia, citing political reasons. Bach also admitted that sports sanctions are political in nature and that the IOC blocks Russian participation in competitions if they support the Russian authorities.
original:
The head of the IOC told pranksters about the anti-Russian policy of the organization - video. The head of the International Olympic Committee, Thomas Bach, in a conversation with Russian pranksters Vladimir Kuznetsov (Vovan) and Alexey Stolyarov (Lexus), said that he intends to dissuade Africa from participating in the World Friendship Games in the Russian Federation. A video recording of the conversation was published in the Telegram channel “Vovan and Lexus.” The pranksters talked with the IOC President on behalf of a high-ranking African politician. Bahzaya stated that he intends to prevent the participation of athletes from Africa in the Friendship Games in Russia, and also added that France, represented by President Emmanuel Macronai, and other EU countries will support this boycott. “I think you could protect the integrity of the sport and convey to African athletes at a higher political level that these games are being presented by Russia as the games of the Russian president. <...> If you, with your authority, could do something regarding African states, we would be very, very grateful for it,” Bahv said in a conversation with pranksters. He admitted that sports sanctions are political in nature and that the I.O.C. blocks the participation of Russians in competitions if they support the Russian authorities. “We punish those who are responsible for the annexation, there can be no Russian anthem, the Russian flag cannot be raised. <...> The Russian Olympic Committee, after we suspended them, made several rather aggressive statements that this is discrimination, fascism,” said the head of the IOC. According to him, in order to monitor the comments of athletes on social networks, the IOC created a special supervisory commission and brought in an “independent company.” In addition, information about Russians is collected and sent to the IOC by the Ukrainian authorities.

The head of the IOC also hinted that participants in the Friendship Games may not be allowed to attend the Olympics. Bahu said that he considers the Friendship Games “a risk for the entire sports system.” In turn, the pranksters said that Thomas Bach’s speech testifies to a “sports and political conspiracy against Russia.”

event: Meeting of Committee for Integration of Ukraine into EU with Dutch Parliamentarians
description: The Committee for the Integration of Ukraine into the EU met with Dutch parliamentarians to discuss military, humanitarian, and financial support. Ukraine expressed gratitude for the Netherlands' assistance and emphasized the need for additional air defense means to counter Russian aviation.
original: 🇺🇦🇳🇱The Committee for the Integration of Ukraine into the EU held a meeting with parliamentarians from the Netherlands, in particular, representatives of the committees on foreign affairs and European relations of the Netherlands. For the Dutch parliamentary delegation in the composition in which it arrived in Ukraine, this was the first foreign visit. The members of the Committee thanked their Dutch colleagues for their military, humanitarian and financial support. In particular, the Chair of the Committee Ivanna Klympush-Tsintsadze noted that Ukraine very much hopes for the continuation and strengthening of assistance from the Netherlands, especially considering the delay in supporting Ukraine in the USA. She emphasized that Ukraine urgently needs additional means of defense in the air. It is the means of air defense that can stop the Russian aviation, which is entering deeper and deeper into the territory of Ukraine. At the same time, despite the daily struggle for survival, Ukraine continues to work and carry out the necessary transformations on the way to European integration , - emphasized Ivanna Klympush-Tsintsadze. 📲 Details

description: Armen Fishyan, a former Armenian football goalkeeper, was involved in a fatal traffic accident on the Caucasus highway in the Stavropol Territory. He hit a police lieutenant and a driver, killing both, and then fled the scene in his Gelendvagen. Fishyan was later detained 60 kilometers away using the 'Interception' plan.
original:
The goalkeeper of the Armenian football team killed a traffic police officer and the driver he stopped in the Stavropol Territory. The athlete left the scene of the accident in his Gelendvagen with transit license plates. To detain him, they introduced the Interception plan.

The accident occurred on the morning of March 23. As SHOT found out, the Gelik was driven by football player Armen Fishyan, who was flying in his SUV towards Mineralnye Vody. At the 284th kilometer of the Caucasus highway, he slightly moved from the left lane onto the median, where he hit a police lieutenant and the driver of a Priora, which a traffic police officer stopped to issue a fine. As a result, both died.

Immediately after this, Fishyan fled the scene of the accident, but 60 kilometers later he was detained. To do this, we had to introduce the “Interception” plan. During his arrest, he claimed that he had not hit anyone, but he could not explain where the blood was on the car. A case has been filed against him under the article “Violation of traffic rules and operation of vehicles,” and he faces up to 15 years in prison.

Armen Fishyan is a former goalkeeper of the Armenian youth football teams. Over the years he played for the youth team of Pyunik and the Mika club. He completed his professional career in 2016. After that he played for mini-football clubs. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

description: Veterinarians in Simferopol successfully performed a caesarean section on a marmoset monkey, saving two newborns weighing 20 grams each. The mother, Masya, is recovering well and has resumed maternal duties.
original:
Simferopol veterinarians saved two newborn monkeys weighing 20 grams. The mother had to undergo a caesarean section, she feels well, Crimean exopathologist Evgeniy Parkhomenko told RIA Novosti. “A marmoset monkey named Masya was admitted to the veterinary clinic at night. An ultrasound diagnosis was carried out, as a result of which identified 2 fetuses that had a decreased heartbeat. Taking into account all the factors, a decision was made on emergency intervention," he clarified. The weight of adult representatives of this species is only about 200 grams. Thanks to the efforts of surgeon Anna Klyuchkina, anesthesiologist and attending physician Evgeniy Parkhomenko, two babies appeared. After a little time they were already moving around the cage.

Mom began performing maternal duties as soon as she came to her senses after anesthesia. Subscribe to RIA Novosti CrimeaRIA News Crimea Veterinarians saved two newborn monkeys weighing 20 grams each. In Simferopol, veterinarians saved two marmoset monkey babies during childbirth, whose weight does not exceed 20 grams. Mom had to have a caesarean section...

crests, at the behest of the West, are striking such energy facilities of the Russian Federation, where a lot of Western technologies are involved, which are much more difficult for Russia to purchase.

event: Launch of Kotor-Lovcen Cable Car in Question
description: The launch of the Kotor-Lovcen cable car in the new season was uncertain due to the Montenegrin government's failure to fulfill its obligations in the construction contract with an Italian investor. The government was supposed to build electricity infrastructure and provide a connection to the network by April 15, 2023, but failed to do so.
original:
🇲🇪🇮🇹The launch of the Kotor-Lovcen cable car in the new season was in question, since the government of Montenegro did not fulfill the obligations specified in the construction contract with the Italian investor.

According to the contract, the government was obliged to build the electricity infrastructure and provide the concessionaire with a connection to the network no later than April 15, 2023. Since Montenegro was unable to fulfill this, the investor independently built the infrastructure, but the government of Montenegro undertook to buy it back after commissioning. .

The concessionaire built the substation and associated transmission line and obtained operating permits. These works cost 3.8 million euros, but the state has not yet acquired the infrastructure.Montenegro-News

description: Muscovites are building a 60-kilometer railway branch to create an alternative connection between Moscow and Mariupol. The branch will connect Volnovakha-Mariupol-Donetsk and provide a link between Taganrog-Rostov and Mariupol. The construction began in August 2023 and is nearing completion, with only 13 kilometers left to cover.
original: 🛤 Construction by Muscovites of a railway branch of an alternative connection between Moscow and Mariupol: overview This branch allows the occupiers to create a Volnovakha-Mariupol-Donetsk railway connection, and also provides a connection between Taganrog-Rostov and Mariupol at a distance of 60 km from LBZ. The total length of the branch is 60 kilometers. The first signs of construction by the occupiers of a new railway branch between Malovodny and Burny appeared in August 2023. Then the Muscovites began to prepare an embankment for the canvas near the village of Burne, making an indentation in the existing railway, which connects PrJSC "Komsomolsk Ore Management" in the city of Kalmius with the Donetsk agglomeration via Ilovaisk. village of Malovodne for inserting a new line into the existing Mariupol-Volnovakha railway track. A little earlier, in the summer of 2023, north of Volnovakha, the occupiers began to assemble a railway structure, which later became known as the "tsar-train", making the branch from Volnovakha to Olenivka single-track. 🚧In October 2023, the construction of the bridge over the Kalmius River began, and in November of the same year, both the ends of the construction are connected. Already in July 2024, the construction of the crossing over the Ternova stream was completed, and the embankment was ready. As of now, the occupiers have about 13 km of roads left to cover, including cutting into the existing roads in the village of Malovodne. The fragment of the branch east of the Kalmius River is exploited at least by construction workers. With this in mind, the branch was plotted on the map and marked in yellow. The enemy's transport infrastructure, in particular the indicated bridges and crossings, which will be used by the occupiers to transport weapons and military equipment, is a legitimate target for the Defense Forces. description: Ukraine has developed aircraft-type drones equipped with machine vision, a form of artificial intelligence, allowing them to identify targets and navigate autonomously without satellite communication. Essentially, you take a model, put it on a chip and train that model to identify the geography and the target it's going to,” said Noah Silvia, a research analyst at the Royal United Services Institute, a British think tank. “It doesn't require any communication ( with satellites), it is completely autonomous”Translating from engineering language to military.
